fields.description:
This is another issue where there are many inconsistencies in Jira's Reports section.  
Steps to Reproduce:
View any completed Sprint in the "Sprint Report" section of the Reports tab.
Under the "Completed Issues" section at the top of the Status Report, view the Story Points completed number on the right hand side.
Above that number, click the blue  hyperlink "View in Issue Navigator" 
On the Issue Navigaor screen choose to Export the report to Excel
Sum the story points in the Done column of the report.
They will NOT match up the Sprint Report completed points.  

This happens to all of my Sprints that have any scope changes after the Sprint begins: Eg. stories are added or taken away, there are sizing changes, etc
There is no consistent apples to apples comparison amongst the reporting screens, even within one reporting screen.  
Can you reproduce this error on your end?  Thank you.
fields.summary: Sprint Report: Completed Issues Story Points do NOT match the story points in Done status when the report is viewed in Issue Navigator and exported

fields.description:
Following from issues GHS-4136 and GHS-4139, I would like to request a variant of the same thing, which hopefully won't be rejected as well :-)
We would also like to support the burndown of story points but without either linking to real time or editing the story point field. A solution that would be suitable for us, and hopefully for others, would be to offer a burndown chart, which shows under the existing curve a stacked area coloured according to the states of the non-completed issues. One would just have to be able to define a colour for each state in the board configuration and then Jira agile could do the rest. Essentially this amounts to a fusion of a cumulative flow diagram with a burndown chart as shown here using the example created by Steve Lane (three states, A, B and C, and 4 issues with 2, 7, 5 and 3 story points respectfully, progressing through the states from A to Done):

!char_proposal2.png!

Original request was:

{noformat}
Following from issues GHS-4136 and GHS-4139, I would like to request a variant of the same thing, which hopefully won't be rejected as well :-)
We would also like to support the burndown of story points but without either linking to real time or editing the story point field. A solution that would be suitable for us, and hopefully sufficiently flexible for others, would be to define partial burndown percentages for the intermediate columns. E.g. one could define an intermediate state/column "development complete - in testing" and associate the column with 70% burndown (with "complete" in the final column for the usual 100%). This wouldn't be 100% correct but at least more accurate and reflect some progress. If one could define the burndown % for any intermediate column in such a way in the board configuration then users could define as many partial burndown states as they wish for the granularity they seek. Clearly the result is that the burndown chart (and respective reports) would apply the respective partial burndown of the issues' SP as they progress through the different intermediate states.
{noformat}
fields.summary: Story point burn down by state transition - Sprint Cumulative Flow Diagram

Previous summary: {{Moving Issue to Another Project would retain the Sprint ID.}}


*Steps to Reproduce*:
# Create a dummy Project A.
# Create a new Board with a New Project B.
# Create a several issues and a sprint.
# Include the issues in the sprint.
# Move one of the issue to the Project A.

# Go to issue navigator and search for issue that is based on Project B Sprint ID.

As the issue is being moved to another project which is out of the Board filter scope, the issue would not listed out.

fields.description:
When using the Agile Scrum board in Jira, I want to see the “summary count” of the remaining open issues, in the collapsed (and expanded) view of the Epics tab.

To calculate the “summary count” I’m referring to, use this math…
“Issues” – “Completed” = “summary count”

*Problem*: Right now, I need to click on each Epic individually to see the summary count in the Backlog view and cannot get an overview of the summary count of all Epics at a glance.

*Request*: Add a summary count numeric field exactly like the current ones, but at the top between the Epic name and the colored pull-down option/arrow (to the left of the colored pull-down). See mock-up below.
This would make this information available without clicking on Epics individually. The summary counts would also be visible without having to expand the Epics themselves, giving you an overview of how big each Epic is at a glance. This would be extremely useful when managing/grooming several Epics at the same time.

Please look at attached image for an example of what this would look like…
fields.summary: Add summary count to Epics

fields.description:
When you try to rank to top an issue with sub-tasks on a Classic board, the issue will not be updated. JIRA displays a message that the sub-task was updated and not the issue and nothing changes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create three issues, one of them with sub-tasks.
# Make sure the one with sub-tasks is not already on top.
# Open the issue with the sub-tasks and under the _More_ menu, choose _Rank to Top_.

h3. Actual results

The issue will not be ranked to to the top.

h3. Expected results

The issue is properly updated and sent to the top of the board.

h3. Workaround

# Open up the Parent User Story.
# Reorder the top subtask down and back up.
# Do 'Rank to Top' and JIRA updates the Parent issue rank.
fields.summary: Unable to rank issues with sub-tasks in the Classic Boards

fields.description:
*Summary:*
 The JIRA Agile column configuration screen does not properly identify the statuses which belong to the board when the conditions below are met:
 # There is an issue type using a custom workflow, with different statuses, AND
 # The JQL filter used by the Board references the issue type above, OR
 ** e.g. Using the filter {{project = P AND issuetype = custom_type OR project = P}} will cause this problem, even though it should return the same results as the filter '_project = P_'.
 # The JQL filter used by the board reference to text
 ** e.g Using the filter {{project = P AND text ~ "testtext"}}

The problem happens when the project/board is configured in such a way that it has multiple workflows (for different issue types). The board seems to only consider the statuses from the first workflow listed under its workflow scheme. The other statuses from the rest of workflow in the same workflow scheme will have a warning triangle indicating that the board doesn't recognize them.

Moving any of the status with the warning triangle to the 'Unmapped statuses' column will make them disappear from the column configuration screen.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
 # Restore the attached XML backup ([^column_issue.zip]).
 # Navigate to Agile > Sample Scrum Project A.
 # Go to Board > Configure.
 # Go to Columns - All statuses are displayed and properly mapped to columns.
 # Go to General and change the 'Working Filter SSPA' to the 'Broken Filter SSPA'.
 # Refresh the Board configuration page for the new filter to be applied.
 # Click on Columns again - The status which do not belong to the workflow used by the issue type "Test Issue Type" will have a warning triangle with the message below:
 "This status is not available in any of the workflows used by this board. To remove, drag it to unmapped statuses where it will no longer be available."
 # Dragging any of those statuses to the *Unmapped Statuses* column will make the status disappear from the column configuration screen.

*Workaround*
 Using the sample filter above
 * {{project = P AND issuetype = custom_type OR project = P}} and changing it to {{project = P AND issuetype = custom_type OR project = P and issuetype in (standardIssueTypes(),subTaskIssueTypes())}}, which yields the same results seems to resolve the problem.
 * {{project = P AND text ~ "testtext"}} is to be changed to {{project = P AND text ~ "testtext" AND issuetype in (standardIssueTypes(),subTaskIssueTypes())}}
fields.summary: Agile Board Column Configuration Missing Statuses

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-11617].
  {panel}

In the case where balancing has split the issues between two buckets e.g.

0|MIN
0|BBB
1|AAA
1|MAX

If a user tries to insert an issue between 0|BBB and 1|AAA the operation will fail with "Between works only within the same bucket".  If balancing is in progress, its possible that the issue can resolve itself.  However if balancing is in a half way state and not running, the operation will fail.

Theoretically you should just be able to use genNext() in these cases rather than throwing the exception.
fields.summary: Inserting an issue at the lexorank bucket boundary could fail

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, for someone to have the ability to start/close sprints, JIRA requires the following. 
1) The project is specified in the filter query for the board.
2) User has administrator rights to the project.

We would prefer that we don't specify a project filter for the board. This is useful when teams are working on multiple projects. Instead of adding all the projects to the filter and granting users Administrator access to all those projects, we would like to specify just the Team in the filter. This means any issue assigned to the team would show up on their board irrespective of the project. It would be nice if we had a separate permission to open/close sprints rather than making someone an administrator and requiring the projects in the filter.
fields.summary: JIRA shouldn't require Project Administrator permissions for starting/closing sprints

fields.description:
My suggestion is an option for compact cards in Work mode.

I recently worked at a place in a team of 6 people where we had our stand-ups by a 60-inch 1080p screen. A lot, if not most, of the time was spent scrolling back and forth to find the issue we were talking about. (The sudden appearance of the details view also seems to consistently confuse people.) The place I'm at now has the same issue and has even chosen not to use Jira Agile for stand-ups for this very reason, which I think is tragic.

Cards as they are now in the (non-classic) Work view have a lot of empty space in all our scrum boards. The sizes of cards in Plan mode however is very compact, and contains enough information for the team to know what it concerns. 

I believe people are still using post-its everywhere because a sprint will not fit in a readable manner in one screen.
fields.summary: Compact cards in Work View

fields.description:
New Transition in Workflow does not reach the Status “Resolved” in Greenhopper

Problem: We have own workflows in subtasks. The subtask “Subtest” has a Transition and Status “Not Tested”. This Status fires a “resolved” event. This Status works fine in our current version of Jira and Greenhopper. This Status and Workflow was created app. 2 years ago.

We need now an additional Status for this workflow. We call it “Skipped” and “Aborted” and it fires a “resolved” event too.

The Workflow looks like this:

!screenshot-1.png!

The Transistion of “Not Tested” and “Skipped” looks like this (I called it here Skipped WW for testing)

!screenshot-2.png!

The Problem shows now in Greenhopper “Classic”. The status “Skipped” never reaches “Resolved” in Greenhopper. Anyway, the status for “Skipped” in Jira is “Resolved”. 

The problem existed in the new Greenhopper Rapid Board too! This is a showstopper for us using the Rapid Board, because a sprint must be “Resolved” before the new sprint can be started.

I heard from a College, that the Problem is gone in our current Rapid Board. But another College still has it. We will check the current Status and come back the next days with more Information. 


!screenshot-3.png!
fields.summary: New Transition in Workflow does not reach the Status “Resolved” in Greenhopper

If the system is in the middle of a balancing operation and issues are split between two buckets.  e.g.
0|MIN
0|AAA
0|AAA
1|BBB
1|MAX

When the healer runs it will try to find a new rank between the first 0|AAA and 1|BBB however it is unable to determine a new rank value when comparing both buckets.

*Temporary Work around:*

*PLEASE PERFORM A BACKUP FIRST*

To identify the rows:
{code}
select * from "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" where "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK"."TYPE" = 1 and not exists (select id from "jiraissue" where "jiraissue"."id" = "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK"."ISSUE_ID");
{code}

Steps to get rid of these rows:
- Taking a backup is strongly recommended. 
- Shutdown JIRA
- Run the following query: 
{code}
delete from "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" where "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK"."TYPE" = 1 and not exists (select id from "jiraissue" where "jiraissue"."id" = "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK"."ISSUE_ID");
{code}
- Restart JIRA
fields.summary: Lexorank Duplicates Checker Fails If duplicates are on the boundary of a bucket

fields.description:
Kanban board columns group together several workflow statuses. It would be nice to be able to re-use this mapping in a JQL function e.g. in {{issueInBoardColumn("board name", "board column")}}. This will simplify queries now having to include long clauses based on status field.

The same idea could also be expanded to create a calculated custom field to have the current kanban column of an issue as a field in issue navigator.
fields.summary: JQL function and API to select issues on a kanban board column

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: As a Scrum Board (Plan View) user, I would like to have a third option in the left margin to expand a Component column that behaves just like the Epic and Version columns. That way, I can click on a component and the board will be filtered on that component, just like it does for Epics and Versions.
fields.summary: Components on Scrum Board - Plan View

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a scrum or kanban board user, I would like to be able to transition my issues between statuses that are mapped to the same column so that I don't have to use the workflow controls to do the transition.

In JIRA Agile v6.6.0, if multiple statuses are mapped to a column, it is impossible to transition a story from one status to another in the same column even though there is valid transition.

In my case, I've created a Kanban board with the columns Not Started - Analysis - Development - Testing - UAT - Done. There are two statuses mapped to each of the middle for columns (e.g. Ready for Analysis and In Analysis, Ready for Development and In Development, etc.). I am showing the status on the card layout to eliminate ambiguity. But I can't move the card from "Ready for Analysis" to "In Analysis" with drag and drop. I have to use the workflow controls instead.  Which renders the whole board pretty unusable.
fields.summary: Allow transitions between statuses in same column on Agile Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Adding+an+Issue+to+an+Epic#AddinganIssuetoanEpic-...whenviewingtheissue/storyinJIRA

Note that the updated epic is reflected on the right panel but not on the main view. After a manual page reload however, you will see the Story get moved to the Epic appropriate Epic swim lane.

fields.description:
INTERNAL USER ASKS:
 
I am trying to execute this query:

status in ("STATUS1", "STATUS2") and fixVersion = "QKB-CI v26" and summary ~ \\-NULL\\-

and it doesn’t work. I am getting issues with –NULL] instead of the ones that I want with -NULL- 

Actually there shouldn’t be any with -NULL- but that is what I want to check for. I have tried various methods to test but it never handles the – correctly. 

I looked online and found this: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-25092

Do we have the version with the escaped special character fix?

--- OUR ADMIN REPORTED:

We are on 6.3.8, so yes, it should work.
text ~ "\\-NULL\\-"

---USER REPLIES:

Even when I run text ~ "\\-NULL\\-" I get a lot of things that don't have -NULL- (dashNULLdash) in them. They just have NULL.
fields.summary: JQL does not work for -- and summary ~ \\-NULL\\-

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a JIRA-AGILE plugin developer I want to manipulate the listing of stories in the PLAN mode of a SCRUM board to _inject_ a bar representing a release between the stories to get an quick overview over the release-plan.

At the one side there are some stories estimated with story points in my SCRUM backlog.
At the other side I manage releases/versions in JIRA, too.
Each release/version has a *fix release-date*, also stored in JIRA.
The JIRA backlog "PLAN view" is a very great view and my single point of planning. I don't want to do some excel exports etc...

Regarding to the current team velocity it is possible to calculate which stories are able to be "in" a specific version and which not. Nothing new so far...

I want to write a plugin that shows exactly this information in the story list of my backlog. Each version should be placed below the story at most be possible to deliver within this version as a "fake story" or as a bar - see attached example for detail.

*My request*
It would be very nice if you provide some extensions to hook into the enumeration of the stories of the backlog to inject a version-bar between two stories.


*Why I want to develop this?*
In the Product-Owners game there are some issues coming up every day there seems to be _more important_ than the planned issues. That's ok so far - but as a PO i want to keep track which issue will be descoped if I add the new one.
=> In this case the issue above a version will fall below the version bar. This is a great visual feedback.
=> In order to this i'm able to drag&drop another - in the meantime _not so important anymore_ - issue below to bar to make a visual release planning.
fields.summary: As a JIRA-AGILE plugin developer I want to manipulate the listing of stories in the PLAN mode of a SCRUM board

fields.description:
Users should have the ability to insert dividers (horizontal lines) into their Agile Board backlogs under Plan view.

For example:
{noformat}story-1
story-2
------division-1--------
story-3
story-4
------division-2--------
story-5
story-6{noformat}
fields.summary: Ability to Add Dividers into Backlog

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
On agile boards, could we have the option to display parent Stories as a large card (they way they are when they have no sub-tasks), and display their Sub-tasks as smaller 1 row height under them (regardless of whether swimlanes are neabled or disabled).

Currently it's the parent stories that are displayed with only 1 row height (and greyed out) above their sub-tasks.

Benefit: This would make standups around a Jira much more efficient, and the overall progress of stories much clearer (whereas the very granular details of sub-tasks are of less interest during standups - and therefore, it's much easier to expand them when working normally at desk, than having to expand parent stories during standups around a shared big screen).
fields.summary: Display Stories as large cards and sub-tasks as small cards.

Currently Rank only supports Ascending sort order e.g. ORDER BY Rank ASC. If the filter query of a board is updated and DESC is used instead, trying to rank an issue throws this warning message:
bq. (!) Ranking is disabled, as the Filter Query for this board is not ordered by Rank. Please check your +filter configuration+.

fields.description:
Personally, I love JIRA Agile. However, we also have some projects within our organization that use Pivotal Tracker, and many employees prefer Pivotal Tracker to JIRA Agile. Here are some things that I have heard Pivotal Tracker does better than JIRA Agile, that I think might get more people (at least within our organization) to use JIRA Agile:

* Separation of backlog vs. icebox. Having everything in the backlog makes it difficult to maintain. Having a concept of an Icebox (features that you don't know are a "go" yet) is a major plus. You *can* configure JIRA Agile to use filters to separate out backlog vs. icebox (perhaps using labels), but it is more difficult than it should be. Backlog and icebox tickets should be a built-in concept, rather than something you have to configure to get working right, and then train users to use correctly.
* Velocity calculation: It is not obvious what the velocity for the project is, and the way that velocity is calculated is not very configurable. The velocity for the project should be right in front of everyone on both the planning and current sprint boards. It wouldn't hurt to have a way for you to see more details on the calculation of the velocity, either.
* Future sprint planning. Pivotal Tracker automatically organizes all tickets in the backlog into sprints for you. You can easily drag-and-drop issues in and out of sprints, but PT doesn't force you to manually create each sprint, it just automatically calculates the next several sprints based on the velocity projected for the project. This is a BIG deal in my mind (being a JIRA agile fan) as well.
* Team member strength in velocity calculation is also a big deal. For us, the teams change regularly, and having a way of indicating that we are not at 100% capacity in team strength, and having that affect the velocity projection is really useful.
* Because JIRA supports customizable fields, I think it would be imortant to have a more advanced configuration screen for the boards to allow the admin of a JIRA project to configure the fields that are shown in the issue lines and the issue details screens. Also, all fields that are on the issue details screen should be editable within JIRA Agile. Having to swap from the JIRA Agile screen to the native JIRA edit screen is *not* intuitive.

That's all I am aware of for now. I hope these suggestions help make JIRA Agile even better. I would love to continue using it.. But, being one of the only ones, I'm fearful I may not be able to forever unless some of these suggestions are addressed.
fields.summary: Pivotal Tracker features that make things easy

  {panel}

h4. Summary:
On the *Plan mode* (Scrum board), under a sprint, there is a "create issue" button which will create issue to that particular sprint. The problem happens when there is a required field for issue creation. It will prompt create issue dialog box to enter the required filled, and this steps removes the value of "Sprint field" which previously has been assigned.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Go to *JIRA Agile plan mode*
# Refer to the inactive sprint
# Refer to *create issue* option on the bottom of that particular sprint
# Enter the issue summary (sprint is automatically assigned to the particular sprint)
!step1.png|thumbnail!
# Click on "create issue" button under that particular sprint
# It will prompt the "create issue" dialog to enter the values for required fields
# The value of sprint becomes NULL (empty)
!step2.png|thumbnail!
# This causes the issue to be created in backlog
!step3.png|thumbnail!

h4. Expected Behavior
The value of *Sprint* field should not get removed when it prompts the create issue dialog box

h4. Additional Information
- Occurs in JIRA 6.3.9 with JIRA Agile 6.6.13
- This does not occur if there is no required field (which will not prompt create issue dialog box

h4. Workaround
The workaround would be to reenter the sprint value when the create issue dialog box is being prompted.
fields.summary: Required Field causes Sprint value to be NULL when create an issue from Sprint

fields.description:
I came across an issue similar to what is mentioned in GHS-10110. I have seen a couple of mentions of it but no mention as to the cause.

In my case there is a specific action that is causing the large offset in the value of Days in Column and that is transitioning to the same status the issue is currently in. e.g. Issue is in "In Progress" and you transition to "In Progress". The vaule of the "Days in Column" changes to 16434. Not that this value is slightly different for different statuses.

Transitioning to the same status is something that is possible in workflows that allow transition from "All" to a status, such an agile simplified workflow.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
1. Create or use a project with an agile simplified workflow.
2. On a Kanban board, transition an issue to the same status it is currently in.
3. View Days in Column

The impact of this issue is not very high as the actual data of the days spend in each column seem to be correct and it is only the display value and dot bar that is offset incorrectly. Transitioning the issue to any other status and then back corrects Days in Column value.
fields.summary: Days in Column value offset by a large incorrect amount when status transitioned to is the same as source.

fields.description:
At the moment, the behavior of the Control Chart is as follows:

Assume you have an issue which has passed through status A, B, C and is currently in the status D. If you select the columns A, B, C and D, the issue will still display in the control chart because it *was* in A, B or C before. If the issue moved across transition accordingly (A > B > C > D) the horizontal displacement of the issue in the chart is the time/date it transitioned out of C because it is the last status it transitioned out of (even though it has not yet transitioned out of D).

It would be better to have it such that if A, B, C and D is selected, the Control Chart will only show the issues once it has passed through *all* A, B, C and D. If the issue is still in D, then it shouldn't show in the Control Chart.
fields.summary: Control Chart behavior for selected columns

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Viewing+the+Control+Chart

The above documentation states the following
{panel}As shown on the chart legend, each dot represents an issue or a group (cluster) of issues:
* The vertical placement of the dot represents the cycle time for the issue, i.e. the 'Elapsed Time'. For a cluster of issues, the dot is placed at the average cycle time for the issues.
* The horizontal placement indicates when the issue(s) transitioned out of the last status selected on the chart (in Columns). For example, if you are using the JIRA Software Development workflow and have selected 'In Progress' and 'In Review' as the Columns on the Control Chart, the dots will indicate when the issue transitioned out of the 'In Review' status.{panel}

This sometimes gives an impression that issues will only be visible in the Control Chart once they have passed through *all* of the columns selected (in this case, one it passed through *In Progress* and *In Review*).

However, this isn't the case. If the issue is still in *In Review*, it will still be displayed in the Control Chart with the horizontal displacement being when it transitioned out of *In Progress*.

Please update this documentation to better explain the intended behavior of the Control Chart to avoid misunderstanding.
fields.summary: Update Control Chart Documentation

fields.description:
h4. Summary
With workflows created by jira agile the descriptions of the post functions are referencing the java objects instead of the descriptions, please see the attached screenshot.

h4. Environment
* JIRA Software Scrum Default Workflow

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Select *Manage Boards*
# Create Board
# Create a Scrumb board
# New project and a new board
# Fill in Board / Project name
# Select *Agile Simplified Workflow (reocmmended)
# Create Board
# Go to workflow for this newly created project
# Select a transition
# check the Post Functions

h4. Expected Results
A description of the post functions.

h4. Actual Results
{quote}
*The following will be processed after the transition occurs*
# *Type:* class
*Class:* com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.UpdateIssueFieldFunction 
*Arguments:*
field.name = resolution
field.value = 
# *Type:* class
*Class:* com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.UpdateIssueStatusFunction
# Add a comment to an issue if one is entered during a transition.
# *Type:* class
*Class:* com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.GenerateChangeHistoryFunction 
# Re-index an issue to keep indexes in sync with the database.
# *Type:* class
*Class:* com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.event.FireIssueEventFunction 
*Arguments:*
eventTypeId = 13
{quote}
!jira_agile.png|thumbnail!

h4. Workaround

For Jira administrator:
 * If you need to edit the generated workflow, create your own workflow instead of editing or copying the generated workflow

For system administrator:
 # [Stop JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/start-and-stop-jira-applications-938847802.html]
 # Make sure to [backup data|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/backing-up-data-938847673.html] just in case
 # Fix the descriptor
 ** For instance:
{code:none}
$ W_ID="10200" # Change this value as the affected workflow ID
$ DB_NAME="__JIRA_DATABASE_NAME__"
$ psql ... -d ${DB_NAME} -c "Copy (select descriptor from jiraworkflows where id = ${W_ID}) To STDOUT;" > descriptor_${W_ID}.xml
# Edit the xml file (Remove '\n' and the redundant line breaks)
$ psql ... -c "update jiraworkflows set descriptor = '$(cat descriptor_${W_ID}.xml)' where id = ${W_ID}" ${DB_NAME}
{code}
 # [Start JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/start-and-stop-jira-applications-938847802.html]
 # Verify the affected workflow is fixed (Discard the draft workflow if exists)
fields.summary: JIRA Agile Simplified Workflow - Post Functions displayed incorrectly

fields.summary: New project sidebar broken after migrating to server

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
After in-place upgrading JIRA from 5.0.5 to 6.3.10, all issues on unstarted sprint are not displayed.

We can reproduce this problem with MySQL and PostgreSQL.

*Step to reproduce*
# install JIRA 5.0.5(vanilla state)
# install JIRA Agile 6.1.6
# create project A
# create issues in project A
# create project B
# create issues in project B
# create scrum board A
# create sprint on board A includes project A issues only
# start sprint on board A
# create scrum board B includes project B issues only
# create sprint on board B (leave this sprint as unstarted)
# shutdown JIRA 5.0.5
# upgrade JIRA from 5.0.5 to 6.3.10 by [rapid upgrade method|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA+Using+a+Rapid+Upgrade+Method](in-place DB upgrading) by linux 64bit installer
# upgrading JIRA 5.0.5 to 6.3.10 completed
# install JIRA Agile 6.6.13 via UPM
# all issues are vanished in unstarted sprint on board B

*Workaround*
We discussed this problem with Atlassian Support team.
We found that this problem did not occur by manually upgrade method(using XML backup file), but it's inconvenient on large JIRA instances.
fields.summary: unstarted sprint is empty after upgrading

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I am using Jira on Demand. I tried to bulk edit the sprint (move issues from sprint A to B). I entered the NAME of the sprint in the field shown in the bulk edit dialog. The system crashed with the exception shown below. I later tried it again and entered the sprint id - this worked (and made me very happy ;-)). 

So actually I see two issues:
a) the system should not crash hard, but throw an error message, that my user input is not valid
b) the ui should give me some hint that I may NOT enter the sprint name in this dialog (As far as I can see this is not consistent through the software).

An error occurred whilst rendering this message. Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug. fields.description:
If you click the dropdown menu "Classic Planning Board" and choose "Classic Chart Board", it is loading but ended up being in the "Classic Planning Board". Basically, there's no way of going to "Classic Chart Board".
!classic_1.jpg|thumbnail!
!classic_2.jpg|thumbnail!

But if you choose "Classic Task Board" and "Classic release Board" it is directing to the correct page.
fields.summary: Classic Chart Board not showing

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We use a combination of single issues and parent/subtask issues. Often the parent/subtask issues are used by us to indicate that when working on a change/bug(the parent task) we also tackle some other small issue (the subtask). When we look at the agile board, the only thing we can see is the status of the subtasks, not of the parent task. It is thus also impossible to drag the parent issue from one column/swimlane to another like we can do with simple issues or subtasks.

Especially when trying to see how far we are in the sprint, it would be good to see in which column/swimlane the parent task would fall. 
I can imagine an indication like the one on the left hand side of the simple issue blocks (a colored bar, depending on the issue type), but horizontal on the bottom of the bar covering all swimlanes. The indication bar would then be displayed over the swimlane the issue is in.
fields.summary: Show parent issue status in Agile board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
1. Open Write!.exe
2. Go to Desktop and push combinations of buttons Ctrl+Shift+Esc
3. In Task Manager go to "Процессы"
4. Make sure that the program uses a lot of memory

Exp. result
The program doesn't use a lot of memory
Actual result
The program uses a lot of memory
fields.summary: Write!: the program uses a lot of memory

fields.summary: Make Cumulative Flow Diagram and Control Chart report as dashboard gadgets

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When '<' or '>' is present in the version name, then it would not be able to be shown properly in the Plan mode of the board

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a board with some issues
# Create a version with '<' or '>' in it, for example, '2>1'
# Set that version as the Fix Version of one of the issues in the board, and this will be the result :
!version1.png|thumbnail!
#* If the version name has a space, it would still be the same :
!version2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Additional info
This was tested on JIRA 6.3.9 with JIRA Agile 6.6.13
fields.summary: The version doesn't show up properly on the Plan mode if '<' or '>' is present

fields.description:
Burndown Chart and date axis is not properly aligned when only working days are selected. Checking "Show Non-Working Days" produces correct alignment of the time axis and the changes in chart.

Check attached screenshots. The last work is done on Nov 21 which is correctly displayed when non working days are shown. But when only working days are selected then it looks like the last work is done on Nov 20.
fields.summary: Burndown Chart and date axis is not properly aligned when only working days are selected
